articles.headline: Russia Prepares to Block LinkedIn After Court Ruling
articles.snippet: The social network for professionals was found to have violated a law requiring it to store local users’ data within the country.
articles.abstract: The social network for professionals was found to have violated a law requiring it to store local users’ data within the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: LinkedIn, the social networking site for professionals that will soon be bought by Microsoft, is to be blocked in Russia after a local court ruled on Thursday that it had breached the country’s data protection rules, a sign of growing tensions for American tech companies operating in the country.

articles.headline: With Trump’s Election, a Bonanza for Washington Lobbyists
articles.snippet: Businesses and corporations hopeful that gridlock will end in Washington have started turning to lobbying firms on K Street to help them navigate the change.
articles.abstract: Businesses and corporations hopeful that gridlock will end in Washington have started turning to lobbying firms on K Street to help them navigate the change.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Trent Lott, the former Republican senator from Mississippi, had gleefully flown back from Florida, where he had been working for the campaign of Donald J. Trump. Now a powerful lobbyist, his phone had been buzzing nonstop and he was busy helping to organize a briefing Thursday morning for dozens of corporate clients.

articles.headline: Trump’s Victory Bodes Well for Investors — for Now
articles.snippet: Defying expectations, the stock market rebounded as investors cheered the changes a Donald Trump administration was likely to bring.
articles.abstract: Defying expectations, the stock market rebounded as investors cheered the changes a Donald Trump administration was likely to bring.
articles.lead_paragraph: To the long list of pundits who called the election all wrong — as well as its likely consequences — add Wall Street analysts.

articles.headline: Chuck Schumer Prepares for His Next Challenge: Leading Senate Democrats
articles.snippet: The New York senator, the new minority leader, will need the conciliatory skills he has developed over the years, faced with Republican control of Congress and the White House.
articles.abstract: The New York senator, the new minority leader, will need the conciliatory skills he has developed over the years, faced with Republican control of Congress and the White House.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In 2012, Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York, made an arresting offer to Senator Scott Brown, the Massachusetts Republican whose 2010 special-election victory had upended President Obama’s agenda. Help Democrats pass legislation to blunt the force of money in politics, he said, and they would not mount a serious challenge to Mr. Brown’s re-election.

articles.headline: In China-U.S. Trade War, Trump Would Have Weapons
articles.snippet: If he chooses, the new president could move on steel to back up his campaign rhetoric. China has fewer options but could aim at jetliners and carmakers.
articles.abstract: If he chooses, the new president could move on steel to back up his campaign rhetoric. China has fewer options but could aim at jetliners and carmakers.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — As a candidate, Donald J. Trump aimed some of his most blistering words at China, declaring that “we already have a trade war” and suggesting ominously that “we have the power over China, economic power.”

articles.headline: Female Clinton Supporters Are Left Feeling Gutted
articles.snippet: Clinton supporters across the country are just starting to process their feelings about the long roller coaster ride that in their view ended in disaster.
articles.abstract: Clinton supporters across the country are just starting to process their feelings about the long roller coaster ride that in their view ended in disaster.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. — It was visceral. Women felt gutted, shocked, appalled, afraid. The prospect of celebrating the election of the nation’s first female president had been crushed by a man whom many women viewed as sexist.
articles.byline: By Katharine Q. Seelye and Claire Cain Miller

articles.headline: ‘Never Trump’ Becomes ‘Maybe Trump’ in Foreign Policy Sphere
articles.snippet: Foreign policy luminaries who served in the two Bush administrations largely derided Donald J. Trump, and it was mutual. But some of the establishment figures’ opposition is softening.
articles.abstract: Foreign policy luminaries who served in the two Bush administrations largely derided Donald J. Trump, and it was mutual. But some of the establishment figures’ opposition is softening.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Like no other part of the Republican establishment, the party’s foreign policy luminaries joined in opposition to the idea of a Donald J. Trump presidency.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti, Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: The Women Who Helped Donald Trump to Victory
articles.snippet: The women, mostly white, said it wasn’t so much about voting against Hillary Clinton, but about the change they thought Mr. Trump would enact.
articles.abstract: The women, mostly white, said it wasn’t so much about voting against Hillary Clinton, but about the change they thought Mr. Trump would enact.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAZARETH, Pa. — Debbie Biro became a Republican to vote for Donald J. Trump.

articles.headline: Trump Campaigned Against Lobbyists, but Now They’re on His Transition Team
articles.snippet: To critics of Donald J. Trump, the inclusion of lobbyists and other advisers with industry ties is a sign that he may not follow through on all of his promises.
articles.abstract: To critics of Donald J. Trump, the inclusion of lobbyists and other advisers with industry ties is a sign that he may not follow through on all of his promises.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump, who campaigned against the corrupt power of special interests, is filling his transition team with some of the very sort of people who he has complained have too much clout in Washington: corporate consultants and lobbyists.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Says He May Keep Parts of Obama Health Care Act
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump indicated he would like to keep a provision that forces insurers to cover people with pre-existing conditions and another that allows parents to cover children into their mid-20s.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump indicated he would like to keep a provision that forces insurers to cover people with pre-existing conditions and another that allows parents to cover children into their mid-20s.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just days after a national campaign in which he vowed repeatedly to repeal President Obama’s signature health care law, Donald J. Trump is sending signals that his approach to health care is a work in progress.

articles.headline: We Have a Retirement Savings Problem. Politicians Can Help.
articles.snippet: Half of all Americans who work in the private sector lack access to an employer-based retirement plan and efforts to increase those numbers have not yet amounted to much.
articles.abstract: Half of all Americans who work in the private sector lack access to an employer-based retirement plan and efforts to increase those numbers have not yet amounted to much.
articles.lead_paragraph: It should be easier to save money for retirement. We can all agree on that, right?

articles.headline: Vice President-Elect Pence to Take Over Trump Transition Effort
articles.snippet: Mr. Pence will take the reins from Chris Christie, the governor of New Jersey, who had been in charge of the transition for the past several months.
articles.abstract: Mr. Pence will take the reins from Chris Christie, the governor of New Jersey, who had been in charge of the transition for the past several months.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Vice President-elect Mike Pence will take over as the leader of Donald J. Trump’s transition effort, pushing aside Chris Christie, the governor of New Jersey, as Mr. Trump moves quickly to assemble a government after his stunning upset victory, the transition team said on Friday.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Maggie Haberman and Michael S. Schmidt
